intro: Paepalanthus trinianus, commonly known as the Andean buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or alpine soils. It has a short stem with few leaves and is part of the family Polygonaceae. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
